greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Rowland's prime-generating sequence: first differences of A106108.
comment: Rowland shows that the terms are all 1's or primes.
See A137613 for additional comments, links and references. - _Jonathan Sondow_, Aug 14 2008
The number of different numbers in the first 10^k terms beginning with k=0: 1, 4, 7, 12, 15, 19, 30, >35, ..., . - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 30 2009
reference: Eric S. Rowland, A simple prime-generating recurrence, Abstracts Amer. Math. Soc., 29 (No. 1, 2008), p. 50 (Abstract 1035-11-986).
Jean-Paul Delahaye, Fascinantes conjectures, Pour la science (French edition of Scientific American), No. 5, 2008
link: Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 .
Brian Hayes, Pumping the Primes, bit-player, 19 August 2015.
Eric S. Rowland, A natural prime-generating recurrence, arXiv:0710.3217 [math.NT], 2007-2008.
Eric S. Rowland, A simple prime-generating recurrence, 2008.
mathematica: a[1] = 7; a[n_] := a[n] = a[n - 1] + GCD[n, a[n - 1]]; t = Array[a, 104]; Rest@t - Most@t (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 30 2009 *)
program: ub=1000; a=7; n=2; while(n<ub, d=gcd(n,a); print1(d,", "); a=a+d; n=n+1; ); \\ _Daniel Constantin Mayer_, Aug 31 2014
xref: Cf. A106108, A137613, A134734, A134743, A134744, A247090. See A106108 for other cross-references.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 28 2008
